data.event: The settlement of Altoona began in 1881 when the Chicago, St. Paul, Minneapolis and Omaha Railway selected the site for a new terminal to replace the overcrowded existing terminal in Eau Claire.

When the location of present-day Altoona - approximately three miles east of the existing Eau Claire terminal - was found to have sufficient flat land and access to water (via the Eau Claire River), the railroad began construction of the new terminal and the community of "East Eau Claire" was platted in October.

event.title: early 1882 and the railroad terminal became

data.event: Residents began moving into the community in early 1882 and the railroad terminal became operational in May of that year.

event.title: was incorporated as a city on April 5, 1887

data.event: Altoona was incorporated as a city on April 5, 1887.
